description: Curriculum sequencing for an English major with a language/linguistics + academic writing emphasis (not literature).

principles: Year 1 builds metalanguage + observation skills (what to notice, how to label it).
Year 2 builds structure (phonology/morphology/syntax) and controlled analysis.
Year 3 builds meaning + discourse + register/corpus and applied research habits.
Year 4 builds specialization + capstone outputs (analysis report, pedagogy design, or writing portfolio).

milestones: Build a personal glossary of 150 core terms (clause, constituent, register, pragmatics).
Write 3 short analytical memos using claim-evidence-warrant.
Run a simple error-log (usage/grammar) and fix via reference lookup.
Analyze 10 sentences with bracketed constituency trees (basic).
Produce a 6–8 page mini-paper: form → function → evidence.
Complete a small corpus snapshot (e.g., 50 headlines vs 50 academic sentences) and compare features.
Write a structured argument that anticipates counter-interpretations (pragmatics).
Produce an annotated bibliography (8 sources) with method + finding + limitation.
Capstone option A: Applied linguistics case write-up + intervention design.
Capstone option B: Register/corpus analysis report (methods + results + implications).
Capstone option C: Academic writing portfolio (revisions with rationale).
